cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper is about improving neural language modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the computer science category. The paper specifically focuses on input representations for language modeling, which is a common topic in the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper introduces a new technique for adaptive embeddings, which is a machine learning technique and could fall under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), or neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper performs experiments on a language modeling benchmark, which could also fall under the sub-category of computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV) since language modeling is often used in tasks such as image captioning.
